sections.title: Design a Portfolio That Matches Your Goals
sections.subtitle: Balance growth, income, and risk tolerance with a structured allocation plan

sections.title: What You'll Build
items: Strategic asset allocation across stocks, bonds, and alternatives

sections.title: Align Allocation With Time Horizon
sections.content: Long-term goals can absorb market volatility and lean heavily on equities, while short- and mid-term goals require more conservative mixes. Match each goal to an account and allocate accordingly.

points.title: Core vs. Satellite
points.description: Anchor portfolios with diversified index funds, then add satellite positions for targeted exposures.

points.title: Tax Efficiency
points.description: Place high-yield bonds and REITs inside tax-deferred accounts; keep broad equity ETFs in taxable accounts.

points.title: Rebalancing Discipline
points.description: Set tolerance bands (e.g., Â±5%) and rebalance quarterly or when bands are breached.

sections.title: Automate Contributions
sections.content: Dollar-cost averaging smooths volatility and keeps the plan on track without emotional trading decisions.

sections.title: Portfolio Design Workshop
steps: List your goals with timelines and target balances.
Complete a risk questionnaire to determine equity/bond splits per goal.
Assign percentages to asset classes within each account (401(k), IRA, brokerage).
Document rebalancing triggers and responsible party.
Track performance against benchmarks quarterly and adjust if goals or life events change.

sections.title: Use Glide Paths
sections.content: For goals like college or retirement, gradually shift to conservative allocations as the date approaches to protect gains.
